results.title: A Working couple
results.creator_credit: Oliver Howes, Gil Brealey and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Human Face of Japan”.
Most Japanese live in the big cities, many of them are salaried company workers, living in housing estates and traveling long distances to work. For many people, life is a struggle. This focuses of Mr Yokohama, a professional office employee and his wife who runs a chemist. Their lives provide an insight as to what its like to live in Tokyo, with a population of twelve million.

results.title: Raw fish and pickle
results.creator_credit: Oliver Howes, Gil Brealey, Australia Japan Foundation and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Human Face of Japan”.
Depicts life in a traditional rural province - Iwate Prefecture - and looks at attempts to improve Japan’s self-sufficiency in food. Also shows traditional fishing songs, traditional dancing and the Morioka Snow Festival. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.title: Lifetime employment
results.creator_credit: Oliver Howes, Gil Brealey and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Human Face of Japan”.
Manufactured exports are basic to Japan’s survival. Conditions of industrial employment are shown particularly in the automotive industry.

results.title: Tomorrow and yesterday
results.creator_credit: Oliver Howes, Gil Brealey and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Human Face of Japan”
The Japanese are well known for their ancient civilisation with its tradition and brilliant festivals as well as its high technology and future-oriented attitudes. This film shows how the two meet.

results.title: The Rice ladle
results.creator_credit: Oliver Howes, Gil Brealey and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Human Face of Japan”.
Japanese women these days face difficulties, especially in the professions as society emphasises the traditional role as the home-maker. Looks at a widow working as a cook’s assistant and a girl studying to be a pop star.

results.title: Human Diversity
results.media_note: Sorry, we don't have images or video for this item.

results.title: Nature or Nurture (TEFC)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Human Diversity”.
Congenital dislocation of the hip in humans is caused by both genetic and environmental factors, and by the interaction between them. Illustrates the methodology involved in sorting out the different factors

group_works.title: The Gee whiz graph (NP)
group_works.creator_credit: Peter Robinson, Antony Jay and Video Arts

results.title: The Gee whiz graph (NP)
results.creator_credit: Peter Robinson, Antony Jay and Video Arts
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “How to Lie with Statistics”.
John Cleese narrates the first of a series of animated cartoons based on the book by Darrell Huff and Irving Geis. Concentrates on the suppression of zero, and the change of scale in graphs. FOR USE ONLY IN A DOMESTIC SITUATION OR FOR EDUCATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY.

group_siblings.title: The Average chap
group_siblings.creator_credit: Peter Robinson and Video Arts

results.title: The Average chap
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “How to Lie with Statistics”.
The second in a series of animated cartoons based on the book by Darrell Huff and Irving Geis about statistical trickery. Concentrates on the use and misuse of averages. Intended for management training, colleges and schools. Narration by John Cleese. Animation by Tony Hart.
